qas.question: What monarch bestowed the first Lord Mayor on Plymouth?
How many councillors choose the Lord Mayor?
What officeholder selects the Deputy Lord Mayor?
Who is the current Lord Mayor of Plymouth?

context: Plymouth was granted the dignity of Lord Mayor by <a0_0>King George V<a0_0/> in 1935. The position is elected each year by a group of <a1_0>six<a1_0/> councillors. It is traditional that the position of <a2_0>the Lord Mayor<a2_0/> alternates between the Conservative Party and the Labour Party annually and that the Lord Mayor chooses the Deputy Lord Mayor. Conservative councillor <a3_0>Dr John Mahony<a3_0/> is the incumbent for 2015–16.
